title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 256/86 of 5 February 1986 on the granting of aid for the private storage of flax and hemp fibres
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 256/86
of 5 February 1986
on the granting of aid for the private storage of flax and hemp fibres
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Intervention agencies of producer Member States shall grant in accordance with the provisions of Regulation (EEC) No 1524/71 and of this Regulation private storage aid for flax and hemp fibres of Community origin.

1. The maximum quantity per contract shall be 200 tonnes.
2. The contract may be concluded only with persons in possession of the product before 15 January 1986.

1. Without prejudice to the provisions of Article 8 (2) (b) of Regulation (EEC) No 1172/71, contracts shall be concluded for a fixed term which at the option of the storer may be of three, four or five months.
2. Contracts must be concluded not later than 31 March 1986.

1. The amount of the aid shall be (per 100 kg per month):
- 2,40 ECU for long flax,
- 1,22 ECU for short flax,
- 1,10 ECU for hemp.
2. Should Article 8 (2) (b) of Regulation (EEC) No 1172/71 be applied, the amount of the aid shall be reduced in proportion with the reduction in the term of the contract.
For the purposes of this Regulation a month shall mean a period of 30 days.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day  following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 5 February 1986.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
